PRINCIPAL DISCHARGE DIAGNOSIS ;
Responsible After Study for Causing Admission ) s / p ventral hernia repair
OTHER DIAGNOSIS ;
Conditions , Infections , Complications , affecting Treatment / Stay s / p Roux en Y gastric bypass .
s / p c-section B12 deficiency Anemia
GERD OPERATIONS AND PROCEDURES :
02/14/03 GRENDWIERST , SONLYN R. , M.D. VENTRAL HERNIA REPAIR W / MESH
OTHER TREATMENTS / PROCEDURES ( NOT IN O.R. )
None
BRIEF RESUME OF HOSPITAL COURSE :
This is a 39 year old female , s / p Roux-en-Y gastric bypass in 09/06 who is admitted for elective repair of a ventral hernia .
The patient went to the operating room on 2/14/03 for repair of the hernia .
The patient was admitted to the hospital overnight for pai n management in the setting of a large incision with large amounts of dissection during the procedure .
She did well overnight with minimal pain medication requirements .
She voided on the morning of POD # 1 .
She had no complaints of nausea or vomiting and was tolerating PO's well .
ADDITIONAL COMMENTS :
No heavy lifting x 3 weeks .
Keep the dressing on and dry for 48 hours after the surgery .
You can shower when you get home .
Avoid getting the incision soaking wet .
DISCHARGE CONDITION :
Stable
TO DO / PLAN :
You should follow-up with Dr. Grendwierst .
Call his office to make an appointment .
Take the pain medication as prescribed .
You can take regular tylenol or motrin for pain and use the percocet for breakthrough pain .
REturn to the ER or call your doctor if you develop fevers , notice pus from the incision , develop surrounding redness , have abdominal pain , have vomiting where you can 't keep anything down or develop any symptoms that concern you .
No dictated summary
ENTERED BY :
MSSHUFFBREUN , RERE N. , M.D. ( KX79 )
02/15/03 01:29 PM
****** END OF DISCHARGE ORDERS ******
